headline: Quick Asian Chili-Lime Chicken Soup Recipe
description: This fast and flavorful soup is like a light Vietnamese chicken pho. Chicken stock gets flavored with green chiles, lemongrass, lime juice, and fish sauce, and the soup gets bulked out with mushrooms, thinly sliced chicken breast marinated in fish sauce, and rice noodles.
name: Quick Asian Chili-Lime Chicken Soup Recipe
keywords: asia, chicken, noodle, quick, soup, southeast asia
recipeIngredient: 12 ounces boneless, skinless, chicken breast, sliced into 1/4-inch strips
6 cups homemade or store-bought low-sodium chicken stock
2 to 3 tablespoons lime juice from 3 large limes
8 ounces white mushrooms, trimmed and sliced into 1/2-inch slices
1 large bunch cilantro, roots trimmed, rinsed
1 medium onion, sliced into thin rings

recipeInstructions.text: Toss chicken with 2 teaspoons fish sauce in a small bowl; set aside. Cover rice noodles with cool water; set aside.

Heat chicken broth, lemongrass, and chiles in large pot over medium heat to simmer. Simmer 5 minutes. Add 1 tablespoon fish sauce, 2 tablespoons lime juice, sugar, and mushrooms. Simmer until mushrooms are half-cooked, about 2 minutes.

Cut stems from cilantro and add to pot. Season to taste with lime juice, chiles, fish sauce, sugar. Add chicken and gently simmer until just cooked through, about one minute. Drain noodles and add to soup. Simmer briefly until cooked through but firm. Garnish with sliced onion and handfuls of cilantro leaves.

review.reviewBody: OMG, food will never cease to amaze me. I loved it!
OMG! best dinner in my life. Coming back next friday.

This was so good.

It's also quite malleable too. Based on the contents of my fridge I substituted the juice from a lemon instead of the lime (didn't think it would work out as well but it was quite nice, and I didn't need to add sugar probably because the lemon has more sweetness to it).

Also put in a half cup of coconut milk I had leftover, a shallot instead of onion and a diced stick of celery ;)

Made this last night. Yum!!! It will definitely make it into my dinner rotation... the perfect combination of delicious, healthy, and filling!

Silly question... In the first part of step 3, do you add the cilantro to the pot, or just the stems? I read that paragraph a half-dozen times and still couldn't tell for sure.

Daunsha3, FWIW, I used 2 seeded jalapenos, and there was a gentle heat. Next time, I'll add another. But we don't like things too zippy, so your mileage may vary!
the recipe calls for green chillis.... what kind? Anaheim? Jalapeno? (they are also green) i am assuming that since you did not seed them they were mild? which makes me think they were Anaheim....?

item.name: Quick Asian Chili-Lime Chicken Soup Recipe
